The object is to score goals, to do this both players are dealt 5 cards and then try to collect 3 club crest if the same type in his hand. The hand is built up rummy-style from the deck. A goal attempt is made by playing three cards face up on the table and is scored unless the other player has a goalkeeper or offside card available to play. Playing 5 club crests automatically scores a goal. After a goal the opponent must discard their hand but the scorer can decide on whether to keep the remaining 2 cards or not. The game ends when 10 attempts at goal have been made.

35349.name: The Detective Game: Suspicion
35349.description:
"Suspicion" is a detective game set in the times of the legendary private-eye Sherlock Holmes.
The playing board represents London.
Each player is a detective whose aim is to solve the crimes of three suspects. There are 24 suspects in all. Each of these bears the name of a fictional Victorian criminal and four items of information. These are:
1. a clue to identification
2. evidence of the crime
3. proof (fingerprint)
4. a district of London
To solve the crime, the detective must collect every item of information on the card.

boardgamehonor.21204: 2009 Charles S. Roberts Best Ancient to Napoleonic Era Board Wargame Nominee

35350.description:
From the publisher's website:

You take on the role of Alexander the Great in his world-conquering quest to extend the Macedonian empire and achieve personal glory.

When playing the game, you are placed in Alexander’s footsteps when he comes of age in 338bc, just before the battle of Chaeronea. From that point on, you get to decide where to travel, when to battle, when to negotiate, and when to seek out divine prophesies to guide your actions.

You are supplied with soldiers and advisers to help you navigate the dangers of the battlefield and the negotiating table. These include Infantry, Archers, Phalanxes, Cavalry, Advisers, Scholars, Courtesans, and Spies. You will craftily combine these resources with your own plans to achieve victory, and glorification. And if you do well, you will be remembered as one of the greatest leaders ever to walk the earth.

The life of Alexander is divided into several campaigns, each spanning several years. During each campaign, you are given goals, but how you achieve those goals is up to you. Do you enter into battle? Or negotiate? How strong are you? How strong are they? What can you gain? These are all decisions you get to make, and must make well, if you are to live up to the immortal standards set before you.

The campaigns can either be played stand alone, or linked to play through his entire life. When played as one on-going life, the outcome of one campaign affects your starting situation in the next campaign.
35350.name: Field Commander: Alexander

35351.name: Slap 'n Grab
35351.description:
The Party Game That's Survival of the Fastest!

Slap-N-Grab is a fast-paced free-for-all where opponents spring into action slapping down and grabbing cards based on colors, counts and cartoon creatures. All the animal cards are dealt out. Cards have 1, 2 or 3 colored animals on them: elephants, rhinos, kangaroos, monkeys or cows. Two Slap Cards are played face up, for example "Four Cows" and "Three red monkeys." Players then sequentially flip over animal cards until exactly 4 cows or 3 red monkeys appear among them all. At that moment, players race to slap the corresponding Slap Card and win the round, taking the slap card as a prize and turning over another one. If you make a mistake and the required animals are not showing, you must return a previously won card to the bottom of the slap deck. When the slap deck is gone, players count how many they have won and the player with the most wins.

35353.name: Merv Griffin's Crosswords
35353.description:
Based on the short-lived (2007-08) game show, players compete to answer crossword puzzle clues to fill in the grid. Puzzles vary in difficulty. Players may play head-to-head, free-for-all, or duplicate the rules of the television series where only two players can score and the other players ("Spoilers") compete to take the place of the scoring players.

Strangely, the board game calls itself "The Social Wordplay Game" and does not identify host Ty Treadway or the fact it is based on the game show.

35354.name: Dry Gulch Junction
35354.description: In Dry Gulch Junction, the players are erecting buildings in the titular town. Each player has a set of Building cards with the Buildings they may construct during the game. Additionally, there is a deck of Improvement cards which have two uses. The first is as an Improvement to your existing Buildings. These Improvements can be the second or third story addition to a Building already constructed. However, the other use of the cards are through the Claims printed at the top of the card. Twice each turn, an Improvement card can be set aside for all players to use as a Claim for money. The Claims allow all players to take money into their general construction fund or to set aside a larger sum of money to improve a specific Building. The player who most efficiently manages their resources and constructs the best Buildings in town will win the game.

35355.name: De schippers van de Kameleon
35355.description: Based on the popular 'Kameleon' series, players each have their own Kameleon boat, with which they need to save four different animals from drowning. Players choose cards to plan their sailing route in the lake, where the animals are. If they have a rescue buoy in the right place in their 'route' they can save an animal. The first player to save all his animals wins the game.

35356.name: Game of Politics, or Race For the Presidency
35356.description:
The Game of Politics, or The Race For the Presidency was first published in 1887 and patented in 1888. Unlike the later game of the same name by Oswald B. Lord, candidates in this game play cards against each other to reach the office of Mayor, Governor, Congressman, and Senator before moving on to a battle over each state's Electoral votes for the U.S. Presidency. 201 votes out of the 401 for all of the states are required to win.

While the game is listed as being for 2, 4 or 6 players, in fact there are only two candidates competing for the Presidency. When there are more than two players, the sides form two teams that play in turn to advance their respective candidates.

Few intact copies of the game seem to have survived to the present day. However, the patent application -- which lists the game's rules -- and surviving game boards give a good indication as to what the components were for the W.S. Reed Toy Company's release. These include:


Rules
Game board
Two "wads" (pawns) to move on the board's tracks; one red, one blue
23 pins for use in the left and right columns
At least one pin to mark the last bypassed state during the first pass through the state list
A deck of 48 cards, containing eight each of the following values: 1000, 2000, 3000, 5000, 7000, and 10000.

35359.description:
A science fiction infantry tabletop miniatures wargame retaining as many 'realistic' features as possible, while striving to minimize complexity.

The game, intended for use with 25/28mm miniatures (of whichever manufacturers the players prefer), features morale and fog-of-war/limited intelligence rules which have a significant impact on the battles - at least as much as actually killing the opposing forces. Troop types from lightly armoured basic infantry (say, Aliens Colonial Marines level) up to heavy power-armoured juggernauts (for example Starship Trooper Mobile Infantry or WH40K Terminators), as well as robots, cyborgs, remotes etc (thus allowing armies from the Terminator films, Cybermen, etc).

Vehicles are intentionally not featured within the rules, leaving it as a game with the focus on infantry (from high tech to very high tech) and their main support weapons.

Rather than treating tabletop battles as simply "line up 1000 points per side and fight until one side is gone" affairs, Killing Machine takes a more intelligent, mature look at this kind of skirmish gaming with its morale and intelligence rules.
35359.name: Killing Machine

35360.name: Druid's Duel
35360.description:
Druid’s Duel is a quick-playing card game. In Druid’s Duel, you’re a druid competing with other druids in a shape changing contest to display your wits and prowess. The druid who best adapts to the tactics of his or her opponents becomes the new head of the Circle.

Everyone starts the game with a full had of strategy cards. Each round you secretly pick a shape (lion, peacock, or jackrabbit) and a strategy card to play. When shapes are revealed, you may or may not get to discard your strategy card, depending on the shapes and strategies of your opponents.

If you’re a Jackrabbit, you succeed if you played the lowest strategy card. If you’re a Lion, you succeed if you played the highest strategy card. If you’re a Peacock, you succeed if no one else played a card that matches your card’s rank or suit. If you’re the first one to discard all of your strategy cards, you win.

Druid’s Duel is a game for two to four players. Druid’s Duel uses a standard Poker deck. You can read the rules at http://www.invisible-city.com/play/470. A four-player game takes about 30 minutes to play. Druid’s Duel is appropriate for ages 13 and up.

35361.name: Say Anything!
35361.description:
From the box:

Say Anything! the more you say, the more you play

Shout Out Some Categories!

Animal, Vegetable, Mineral!

Watch your prompter point to the Say Anything! Playcard. Find out if you are "Hot" or "Cold". Should you go back to a previous word? or Say Anything!? Stuck? Spew more words. Try to get a "Hot" response from your prompter. Keep those categories, ideas and words coming until your team is the first to identify the secret word or time runs out. This fast action twenty questions game with a twist will keep you entertained for hours.

35362.description:
Aniolowie is Polish CCG. It is about the war of Angels fighting in order to gain the human spirits. Aniolowie has got unique, especially created universe. There are plans for first expansion and Role Playing Game.

Homepage: www.gusla.eu
35362.name: Aniołowie

35363.name: Ensign O'Toole  U.S.S. Appleby Game
35363.description:
Based on the '60s TV show "Ensign O'Toole" which starred Dean Jones.

Object of game: To be the first player to travel from the starting place along the progression path to the finish space and thus becomes the winner.

35364.name: Stagecoach West Adventure Game
35364.description:
Based on the classic but short-lived television show of the same name.

Object of game: Luke Parry and his cowboys at the Bar-X Ranch are battling an outlaw gang of cattle rustlers for controls of the range. Each side is equally matched. The first side to capture all the enemy’s men or reach the enemy’s “Finish Space” with 2 men is the winner, but it takes luck, pluck and skill to win.

35365.name: Corps d'Armee
35365.description: Napoleonic miniatures rules designed for larger scale battles using minimum division sized, preferably corps/larger forces. Figure scale of 1 casting representing 50/60 men; 1 artillery model represents 2 guns; ground scale 1 mm = 2 yds.

35366.description:
Ambush is an abstract strategy game for 2 players. Two Icehouse stashes and 4 Martian Coasters are needed, one per player. Players will either play one of their 15 pyramids on the board or set a pyramid aside to rotate a coaster. Either action may allow them to capture a pyramid belonging to their opponent.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces
35366.name: Ambush

35367.name: Deck Deck Revolution
35367.description:
Deck Deck Revolution is a free Print&Play real-time cardgame inspired on Japanese and Korean dancing video games. You can download the game directly from BGG (below, in the Files Section).

You won't need your feet to play, but all elements of the video games are here: chain combos, "frozen" and double arrows, step ratings, etc... This game requires lightning reflexes and mental agility, and people with experience in dancing video games tend to play better.

Players place cards on some stacks chaining arrows of the same direction. Each time you play a card, the next required card on that stack changes, so you have to rethink constantly what can you play in each place. Some arrows have special rules for an additional twist.

It is recommended (but not mandatory) to play with a referee. Original rules are for 2 players only, but a simple variation allows up to 6 players (divided in 2 teams).

35368.name: Battlez FMX Edition
35368.description:
Battlez FMX is an action sports based collectible card & dice game, featuring Freestyle Motocross superstar Brian Deegan, along with Metal Mulisha team members Todd Potter & Jeremy Lusk.

Battlez FMX allows you to battle it out as if in a real freestyle MX
competition, playing as your favorite FMX rider. Score or take points away from your opponent by matching dice combinations on the cards and executing tricks like Kiss of Death's, BackFlip's, Cliffhangers, Rock Solids and more. First player to 100 points wins.

In addition, there are specialty cards such as the Rockstar Energy Drink Boost Card allowing you to roll all 3 dice at once, the Stop Card allowing you to stop your opponent from playing the same card repeatedly and the First Aid Card, immediately subtracting 50 points from your opponent.

35369.description:
From the Looney Labs website:

It's a Martian Invasion-themed version of Fluxx! Just as Zombie Fluxx draws on all those classic Zombie movies for inspiration, Martian Fluxx is about all those great alien invasion stories going back to the original, the War of the Worlds.

Some of the Keepers you'll find in the Martian Fluxx: Mars, the Mothership, the Flying Saucer, the Tripod, the City, the Cow, the Ray Gun, the Space Suit, and the Tentacle.

The Tentacle? I hear you asking. How is that a good thing? All those other things sound like great Keepers but what's good about a tentacle? Well, they're great if you're a Martian... which is what we are in this game!

In Martian Fluxx, the players are invaders from Mars, and the Creepers are those pesky Pathetic Humans who are always getting in our way, keeping us from winning. Cows of course are Keepers because for Humans and Martians alike, they're good eating. There are actually two Cow Keepers in the game; if you have them both you can win with the Goal "Two All-Beef Earthlings."

The idea of making us the Martians came about as I realized the Martians are the ones who get all the cool stuff! Other cool Keepers you'll find include the Abduction Chamber (which you can hide your Pathetic Humans in), the Space Modulator and the Mind-Control Transmitter. And yes, you can use that Ray Gun to vaporize Pathetic Humans. (The Germs Creeper however is harder to get rid of...)

So that's a sneak peek at Martian Fluxx.

Part of the Fluxx series.
35369.name: Martian Fluxx

35370.name: Viaje por España: Senior
35370.description:
"Trip for Spain" it's a game for Ages 8 and up

It stimulates the sense of the planning, introduces in the geography of Spain and in the knowledge of its cities and places of tourist interest.

The quality of the images contributes to the aesthetic education. It favors the social education, as collective game.

Travel for plane and by sea for all the localities of Spain before your opponents!

35371.name: El Juego de la Liga
35371.description:
"The Game of the League" 2003/2004 based on the Spanish Football League.

Content:
- 1 board
- 8 colored player's pieces
- 2 dices
- 8 classification cards
- 67 incidents cards
- 220 football players cards (with all the league star players)
- Bills of money
- Games calendar
- 20 cards of team alignment

35372.description: "300" is a bowling game played with cards. Each card played represents one throw of the bowling ball. As in regulation bowling, each player is entitled to the throw of two balls (the play of two cards) in one frame to get all 10 pins. If a player can get 10 pins by playing only one card, he has thrown a strike which completes his play for that frame. Each game consists of 10 frames. Game is scored according to regulation bowling rules.

35373.name: Bowl
35373.description: Bowl by Tudor has a dual action pin reset and an automatic Gravity Ball return. You rolled your ball on to a lane with pins that look just like a real bowling alley. The pins are numbered above the pin area so that you know which pins are left standing after a roll. The ball rolls back to you because the back of the pin area is raised a bit to force the ball back to you by gravity. At the end of a frame you push two tabs together to reset the pins. Game comes with a scorepad for keeping score.

35374.name: Smarty Party! Gamers' Expansion
35374.description:
Smarty Party - Gamers' Expansion adds dozens of new categories focusing on boardgames and card games...and not those silly mass market games, but the games you love that your fellow Board Game Geeks play! Smarty Party! has long been a favorite party game for gamers, and this expansion seals the deal. A must have for BGG readers and serious (and not so serious) gamers of all ages.

This expansion is available for free to download and print. Express permission to create this expansion was received from R&R Games. Two printed copies exist: "Special Gathering Edition 1 of 2" and "Special Gathering Edition 2 of 2," one of which (1) was made available at the 2008 Gathering prize table, while the other one (2) was made available for play during the 2008 Gathering.

35375.name: Tippecanoe Game
35375.description: The game is about 20 inches long, 14 inches wide, 1 1/2 inches deep. There is a lid which slides out through the top end to reveal the playing board inside. There are yellow wood slats and blue slats that connect to them to let them slide up & down. Some versions of the game come with red wood paddles which are 8 inches long with 2 different length yellow pegs attached which fit into the holes along the sides, but not all versions have this. The game comes with a wooden dowel over 18 inches long and two small steel balls with etched symbols on them. The goal of the game is to move the ball down through the tipped slats so that it ends up going through the 150 metal loop at the bottom in order to score maximum points for your turn.

35376.name: Bandits
35376.description: Bandits is a light Wild West gold rush card game where players attack and defend hide-outs stashed with gold. Booby trap and Backfire cards keep the action fast-paced as momentum swings from hand to hand with every play. Strategy is a key component to this game as players ponder when to stash gold and when to attack with everything they got.

35378.description:
Ca$h 'n Gun$ Silver Saw-off is an extension to Ca$h 'n Gun$. Limited edition (500 prints) presented at Essen 2005.

The shotgun allows you to fire between two players and if you shoot at them, you toss two plaster counters (one for each player) - if it lands with the plaster side up that player gets wounded, otherwise nothing happens. So, you can hit 0, 1 or 2 players at once.
35378.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Silver Saw-off

35379.name: Goofy's Balloon Party Game
35379.description: From Whitman and Walt Disney Productions, this 1975 children's game is won by the first player to play all of their balloon discs onto the balloon circles.

35380.description: Object of game: To be the first player to follow Woody Woodpecker to his tree house. Moves made based on spinner result.
35380.name: Woody Woodpecker's Up the Tree Game

35381.name: Svenska MAD's Götebörsen
35381.description: Similar to The Monopoly Game and The Mad Magazine Game. Published by the Swedish MAD Magazine department as a supplement in the Swedish MAD Magazine (Svenska MAD) No. 4 1976. It was later reissued as a supplement in Svenska MAD´s stora julpajare 1982.

35382.name: Stråtrövarespelet
35382.description:
A game where the players are highwaymen in Sweden during the Middle Ages. The players steal from trader caravans and from each other.

A free print and play-version of this game is now available (see files-section below). Now also a version in English.

35383.name: Deathball
35383.description:
From the Heresy Miniatures website

"Deathball is a popular gladiatorial pit-fighting variant that is played mainly in the Kingdom of Morica, ruled by Dark Duke Henry the Red, also known by his official title of Duke Scaldis II."

My description:

A game of fantasy mayhem loosely based on football, or maybe some ancient religious game from the Aztecs. Mayhem with miniatures, dice and strategy.

In the same family as Blood Bowl and Futbowel

Rules and board can be downloaded free for personal use at http://www.heresyminiatures.com/deathball.htm

35384.name: Monopoly: Detroit Tigers Collector's Edition
35384.description:
From the publisher:

The MONOPOLY Brand is proud to present the
Detroit Tigers edition of the world's most famous board game. After suffering eleven straight losing seasons, the Detroit Tigers were the biggest surprise in Major League Baseball in 2006, taking home their 10th American League Championship in franchise history, Now Tigers fans can take control of the best ballplayers in Detroit. Buy, sell, and trade Kenny Rogers, Placido Polanco, Magglio Ordonez, Ivan Rodriguez, Carlos Guillen and Manager Jim Leyland in your quest to earn your stripes.

35386.name: Tiddle Tennis
35386.description: A tiddly winks variant based on tennis, played on a cloth game board.

35387.description:
This is one of three sets of road sections for Car Wars. Owning all three parts gives you huge flexibility in laying out regular or "autobahn" style tracks. Set 1: Starter Set includes 5 double-sided sheets of regular curves, tight curves and straight road sections along with counters.

Expands:

Car Wars
35387.name: Car Wars Deluxe Road Sections Set 1: Starter Set

35388.description:
A simple game that has a small wooden block with a painted surface that resembles an ice hockey rink as the playing surface, and contains holes for a peg that represents the puck. Players roll three special dice, one for passing, one for shooting and another face-offs. Each die has different outcomes displayed on each side.

Players can choose the length of game themselves.

Comes in a clear 4x3 box, and so is good for travel.

Ages 7 and up
35388.name: Playoff Hockey

35389.description:
Sport Of Kings Challenge: The Horse Racing Quiz Game

"4400 questions to entertain followers of the world's #1 spectator sport!"

"A party game! A study guide! A nostalgia trip!"

This horse racing trivia game includes a colorful race track board, 6 plastic horses, 6 plastic tokens, hundreds of trivia question cards, a die, and 6 category cards.

Players answer equine trivia questions as they move their horses around the track.

(c)1986 Kuriakos Inc.
35389.name: Sport Of Kings Challenge

35390.name: Confrontation
35390.description:
Confrontation was the name given to the original Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader skirmish game set on Necromunda in which gangs fought against each other, and attempted to increase their prestige and equipment.

The game was published over a number of issues of White Dwarf, starting with Issue 130, and with the last installment in Issue 142.

The mechanics focus on realism, allowing characters to make use of cover in specific ways, and requiring them to make specific tests when under fire. Actions are performed on a points basis, so a character could run forward and fire a few badly-aimed shots, or stand still and fire more rounds at a target.

The game contains a large amount of detail concerning combat and psychological effects.

Rules for purchasing and trading equipment for players' gangs, were also included.

The game appears to be the precursor of Necromunda, published five years later.

35391.name: Golden Balls
35391.description:
A game of luck, intuition and barefaced bluff. You have one simple task - get rid of the "killer balls" while keeping the highest value "golden balls" in play.
Vote out your opponents in the first 2 rounds (1 round in 3player), to make it to the "bin or win", and choose your "golden five" jackpot balls.
Face your last remaining opponent in a tense head-to-head to "split or steal".

35392.name: Pokerface
35392.description:
Can you bluff your way to £1million? Based on the hit quiz show, you don't necessarily have to get the questions right to win, you just need to bluff your way through the rounds and pressure your opponents into folding.
You don't have to be the brain of Britain to win, you just have to be clever enough to make them think you are! (taken from back of box)

Players secretly answer 5 multiple choice questions, then try to bluff their opponents into folding a 10second countdown. If no one folds, then the player with the least correct answers loses all their money.

35393.name: Der goldene Kompass: Die Reise
35393.description:
Another Franchise to the movie of the same name, this time in the small BMM-Box.
The players move stacks of character tokens and try to reveal certain characters on the finish line, while avoiding the villain

35394.name: La Mayor Hazaña de la Historia
35394.description:
This game depicts the events regarding the Discovery of America. It consists of two phases, the first one on land and the second one in the ocean. In the first phase, players must travel to Portugal, visit Duke of Medinaceli and the Prior of the Monastery in La Rábida, among others, in order to get Recommendation Cards to be able to get an audience with the Catholic Monarchs (Reyes Católicos). Once they get support from the Kings, players will buy food provisions, ships, hire the crew and set sail into the unknown...
In the second phase, players will have to sail across the immense ocean in order to discover the New World and be able to bring back the news to Spain.

This game (chosen as the Official Game of the 5th Centennial of the Discovery of America) offers you the possibility to become a Hero (the title translates to "the greatest feat/heroic deed, in history").

The contents of the game are the following:
- Semi-reversible game board
- 70 game cards (Event, 'Self Confidence', 'Recommendation Card', Royal Permission and Pinzón Brothers)
- 6 Columbus pawns
- 42 crew counters (21 and 21 sailors)
- 40 food counters
- 84 Ducat Coins (28 of each 1500, 500 and 100)
- 6 Caravels
- 2 Dice
- Rulebook

35395.description:
The year is 1692. In an atmosphere of pessimism and charged paranoia, the citizens of Salem are at the mercy of demons – not demons of the soul, but demons of the mind. What began as a devout Puritan community devolved in a matter of months into a people torn apart by fear, lies, and fanatical orthodoxy. The residents of Salem quickly discovered that they could find Hell all around them.

Salem incites the atmosphere of paranoia that held the village of Salem captive. Players act with the assumption that there are witches among them (and, in this case, there will be). Each player controls six residents of Salem, three of whom are witches. Game play is simple: try to rid the village of witches and keep the identities of your own residents secret.

The game plays over the course of four rounds representing the four months (June–September 1692) in which the hysteria was at its height. Each round has two parts: a Witch Hunt and a Witch Trial, followed by hangings (the dates of which correspond to the four actual hangings that took place in Salem that year). During the Witch Hunt, players send residents to jail and provide alibis for their own jailed citizens. At the end of each round all jailed citizens stand trial. Players then collectively decide who is hanged and who is spared. The player who is most successful at discerning witches from villagers wins!

While the story surrounding the Salem witch trials has become something of a legend, every character in this game is based on a real person whose life was directly touched and in some cases torn apart or taken away by the events surrounding the Salem witch trials. Extensive research has been done to craft the real-life stories of all 42 residents in the game.

While this game focuses on the people and events specific to Salem, Massachusetts, similar witch hunts were taking place as far north as Maine and as far West as Connecticut. Surely, the devil had come to New England.
35395.name: Salem

35396.description: The players place their tiles and try to get as many symbols of the same sort in a row.
35396.name: Shanghai Rummy

35398.name: Europe Marches
35398.description: A 1939 wargame that is very rare and (if you can find it) very expensive. The board features a very colorful map of Europe, with France, Italy, Germany, and England's player areas in the corners of the board.

35399.description:
Orion Attack is an expansion product for the Federation Commander game line.

The nearly final (as of late February 2008) list of ships:
Orion Battle Raider
Orion War Destroyer
Orion Battlecruiser
Orion Heavy Battlecruiser
Orion Double Raider
Orion Slaver
Orion Free Traitor
Commercial Platform
Large Q-ship
Small Q-ship
Defense Satellites
Hydran Gendarme
Lyran Military Police
Gorn Frigate
Romulan SeaHawk
Monitor

Bonus ships (counters only; ship cards found in the associated boosters): Orion OK6, Orion DN, Orion Heavy Cruiser

Though originally announced as an Origins 2008 release, ADB has indicated that it's now a September 2008 product.
35399.name: Federation Commander: Orion Attack

35400.description:
White Star Rising introduces Lock ‘n Load Publishing’s Nations at War (NAW) game system. Based on the popular World at War, NAW depicts platoon level combat in World War II. Here you’ll find everything you're looking for in a platoon-level game -- armor, artillery, infantry that serves as more than cannon fodder, command and control, air support, amphibious landings, and desperate close assaults that leave the victor in possession of the ground and the defeated in headlong retreat, all in eight pages of rules. That’s two less than the World at War system.

Units represent platoons of vehicles, such as M-10 Wolverines, M4A3E8 Easy Eight Shermans, and German Panthers, Tigers, and Mark IVs. Of course White Star Rising isn’t all about tanks. There’s plenty of infantry; paratroopers, line doggies, Fallschirmjaeger, and Volksgrenadiers. In the same vein as the World at War system, the infantry are capable of moving fast and hitting hard. White Star Rising also includes support weapons, such as heavy machine guns, flamethrowers, and satchel charges that infantry platoons can use to lethal effect.

The system throws typical turn-based gaming out the window. The platoons are grouped into formations (usually battalions and kampfgruppen) and led by a headquarters. Each unit of the formation must be within range of the HQ to activate with its formation. Although individual units might activate, and recon units can double their range from the HQ, you’ll want to keep those formations together. The formations are activated by chit draw, and better-trained, better-led units can activate more than once in a turn, moving, shooting, and fighting in each activation. On the flip side, there is no guarantee that a formation will activate even once. The cup into which the formation chits are placed is seeded with end turn chits. When the second end turn chit is drawn the turn ends. Doesn’t matter if a single formations has activated; the turn is over. It keeps you on your toes.

When attacking, each platoon rolls a number of dice equal to its firepower. Every die that equals or exceeds the “to hit” number (right superscript) hits the target. The target then rolls a number of dice equal to its armor factor plus terrain advantages. Each die that equals or exceeds its armor factor negates a hit. The first hit disrupts a unit, second reduces it, the third eliminates it.

Units may also close assault, entering the opponent’s hex to either deal a death blow or force him (or her) out of valuable terrain. Same procedure, but both units use their close assault value. The side that takes the most hits must retreat from the hex. Infantry is VERY good at this, especially against armor without its own infantry support.

Game includes rules for thin-skinned vehicles, support weapons (actual counters that represent heavy machine guns, flamethrowers, and satchel charges that add to an infantry platoon’s capabilities), air support, bunkers, wire, artillery, mines, overruns opportunity fire, line-of-sight rules that have been streamlined since their inception in World at War, transporting infantry--and all in eight pages of rules.

Contents

2 sheets (approximate 200 total) .75" counters
4 professionally-drawn, printed, 11" x 17" geomorphic maps
18 scenarios
2 players' aid cards
4 dice
20 page full color rule, scenario, and chart book.




Other Games in Series:

Nations at War: White Star Rising
Nations at War: Desert Heat
Nations at War: Stalin's Triumph
White Star Rising: Airborne
White Star Rising: Operation Cobra




Re-implements:

World at War: Eisenbach Gap
35400.name: Nations at War: White Star Rising

boardgamehonor.21716: 2012 JoTa Best Game Released in Brazil Nominee

35401.description:
From the publisher:

Galáxia S.A. is an exciting game where player will build an intergalactic economical empire! The players will dispute every single piece of the galaxy by acquiring the right to explore planets that produce several goods. These are to be sold at the intergalactic market. But the galaxy is a dangerous place and your opponents will use cunning and intrigue to make your journey harder. Come aboard this adventure and become the most successful cosmic tycoon!

Galáxia S.A. is played in turns that are composed of the following phases:

Action Phase
Purchase of technology
Resources Generation Phase
Exploration Phase
Planets Auction Phase

With a fresh look and a high replay value, the game will give players hours of fun.

Galáxia S.A. é um emocionante jogo de construção de um império econômico estelar! Os jogadores disputam cada pedaço da galáxia, adquirindo o direito de exploração de planetas que produzem diversos bens e devem vendê-los no mercado intergaláctico. Mas a galáxia é um lugar perigoso, e seus adversários usarão de artimanhas e intrigas para atrapalhar a sua jornada... Então embarque nessa odisséia para tornar-se o mais bem sucedido magnata cósmico!

Galáxia S.A. é jogado em turnos que são compostos pelas seguintes fases:

Fase de Ação
Compra de tecnologia
Fase de Geração de Recursos
Fase de Exploração
Fase de Leilão de Planetas

Com um visual inovador e com uma alta rejogabilidade, o jogo proporcionará aos jogadores horas de diversão.


Cosmic Mogul is a non-collectible card game for 3-4 players. During the game, players become cosmic moguls, searching the galaxy for new worlds to exploit as they build their economic empire one planet at a time.

Illustrated by Michael Christopher.
Brazilian Version Illustrated by Marcelo Bissoli

Home Page: http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/galaxia/


Magnata Cósmico é um jogo sobre comércio interplanetário e compra de planetas. Os jogadores podem comprar planetas, negociar bens a comprar tecnologias, criando um império econômico. De 3 a 4 jogadores.

A Arte e o Design/Gráfico por Michael Christopher.
Versão Brasileira Ilustrada por Marcelo Bissoli
35401.name: Galáxia S.A.

35402.name: Money! Money!
35402.description:
From Box:
"Build your knowledge of money, how to earn it, and how to spend it in this exciting game!"

Players advance on the board by rolling a die. Generally at each space the player earns the indicated amount of money, but before collecting, must spin the arrow which often excludes a coin denomination from the payout. The player then takes the earned money from the bank honouring the exclusion. Some special spaces provide a cash windfall or the ability to earn additional money by exchanging coins for higher denomination coins. Game ends when a player reaches the Finish space and winner is player with the most money.

Educational game aimed at developing children's knowledge of coin money and their ability to perform basic addition.

Canadian version has $1 'Loonie' coins in place of $1 bills.

35403.name: Irány a játszótér!
35403.description:
"Irány a játszótér!" means "Let's go to the playground!".
This is a classic Hungarian children's game from the mid 1980s.
It's a simple roll and move game where you have to visit all the games in a playground.

35404.name: Manók tánca
35404.description:
Classic Hungarian game from the mid 1980s.
The title in English is "Dance of the Dwarves".

Each players get 4 dwarves in his/her color, and places them in their start places at the middle of the board.
Your goal is to lead your people around the board to the home place of your color with a simple roll and move mechanic.
The catch is that all players' meeples looks exactly like the same (check pictures), because your color is shows only at the bottom of your meeples, so when you're on the move you can easily mix up your people with other players' people. You can check your meeples only at the home site.

35405.name: Walt Disney character Guldgrävarspelet
35405.description: A very old and rare Walt Disney game, which also have unusual game mechanics for a Disney-game. The players shall collect gold, and also steal gold from each other and try to hide their own gold.

35407.name: Det nya Europa
35407.description: A game published and distributed 1994 by the YES-side during the European Union-referendum in Sweden. Players shall roll the dice and move and then learn about the "new" and the "old" Europe.

35408.name: Spelet om Amerikas städer
35408.description: Each player asks another player for a city card, and if he has it he has to hand it over. The goal is to complete as many sets as possible (each set corresponds to a province, and contains a varying number of cities).

35409.name: Sherlock Holmes
35409.description: The play of the game is simple and very exciting, and is entirely new. Any number, from 3-8 can take part. The object is to capture as many "burglers", "robbers" and "thieves" cards as possible and to obtain the valuable "Sherlock Holmes" cards. All players play at once and there is never a dull moment. A large part of the fun of the game consists in making a "sweep" by turning up the card "Sherlock Holmes" thus allowing you to quickly seize an opponents pile of cards which would contain the most "robbers", "thieves" and "burglers". Players can also call "Scotland Yard", forcing everyone to pass 3 cards to the player on his left. The first player to 50 points wins the game.

35411.name: Buster Brown Hurdle Race Game
35411.description: This is a rare children's game, probably published in the early 1900s. The cover features some children and animals jumping over hurdles. The board has a track circling the outside of the board with a picture of a band playing on the green interior of the track. Also on the interior of the track are four cheering adults, a tepee, and a table set for dinner (with lobster being served).

35412.name: Speiderpatruljen
35412.description:
A cardgame for 3-5 players somewhat similair to Elfer Raus, but you have only cards from 1 to 10 in five suits (you use one suit pr. player) and that you can only play max. one card from your hand each turn.

Together with Cachons (and maybe Stopp), Speiderpatruljen is one of the classic card games from Damm.

35413.name: Gruftmeister Adventure
35413.description:
From the publisher's web site:
"The new dimension in dungeon-games

Gruftmeister Adventure says goodbye to dice and chance-oriented fighting-systems. Here you fight the undead with your skill.

Up to four players explore the crypt of count Gramwuml in search for treasure. Behind every door there's fear: Go to the arena and fight. Playing a cryptrunner, thief, fighter or magician, you try to beat the other players. But even when there's no other player, Gruftmeister Adventure can be played as a solo-adventure.

Players start at the skeleton of count Gramwuml. From there they explore the crypt room by room, adding new floor tiles. Use actions to explore the crypt, open doors, fight undead or cast spells. Once you encounter a closed door or a coffin, you go to the arena and fight with your skills. A real challenge for both younger and older players. Finally no more orgies of throwing dice.

Gruftmeister Adventure is a totally new game, you don't need an older version of Gruftmeister. Everything needed for the adventure is included: 18 floor-tiles for all-new adventures every time, 140 cards for monsters, treasures, doors, spells, more than 100 wooden pieces, the fighting arena with all the parts for thrilling duels."

Re-implements:

Gruftmeister

35414.name: The Chain Game

boardgameversion.210533: Out of the Box Red edition

35414.description:
From the manufacturer's website:
"Unlock your mind for spontaneous laughter! Race to say a common phrase using one word from the previous phrase. Keep the chain going and you keep your links. If the horn blows, the time is up, and you lose a link."

The game consists of 216 word cards, a squeeze-the-bulb bicycle/clown horn, and 36 plastic links. One player starts by reading a word - for example, "check." The next player may say, "checkmate," the next, "blank check," and the next, "blank slate." And so on around the circle, till one player blanks out and can't think of a combination involving the previous words within 5 seconds. Then the horn is honked and that player must remove a link from the chain they were given at the start of the game. When any player loses their last link, the game is over and whoever has the most links left wins.

35415.description:
From the publisher's web page:
For 900 days, German troops ringed the city of Leningrad, trying to capture the Cradle of the Revolution while Soviet soldiers and militiamen fought just as desperately to keep them out. Nazi savagery caused the deaths of well over a million civilians.

Repeated assaults failed, as did Soviet attempts to break the siege. "St. Petersburg," raged Adolf Hitler, "must be erased from the face of the Earth." Not until January 1944 did the Red Army finally drive the Germans back from the city's outskirts.

Siege on Leningrad is a supplement based on the German assaults on Leningrad's defenses, and the Soviet attempts to re-open communications.

Mike Perryman has designed ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that took place along Leningrad's defensive perimeter.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Eastern Front and Road to Berlin games and Red Warriors and Sinister Forces supplements.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Expands:

Panzer Grenadier: Eastern Front
Panzer Grenadier: Road to Berlin
Panzer Grenadier: Red Warriors
Panzer Grenadier: Sinister Forces
35415.name: Panzer Grenadier: Siege of Leningrad

35416.description:
From the publisher's web site:

March on Leningrad is a supplement based on the German drive to capture Leningrad, and the Soviet defense of the approaches.

Mike Perryman has designed ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that took place south of Leningrad between June and September 1941.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Eastern Front and Road to Berlin games and Red Warriors and Sinister Forces supplements.

Each scenario has its own card in a spiral-bound booklet, just like the popular North Wind and Alaska's War.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Expands:

Panzer Grenadier: Eastern Front
Panzer Grenadier: Road to Berlin
Panzer Grenadier: Red Warriors
Panzer Grenadier: Sinister Forces
35416.name: Panzer Grenadier: March on Leningrad

35418.name: Old Mother Hubbard
35418.description: Actually a spin and move game from Cadaco from 1954. The game includes a pictorial peg board, a Mother Hubbard spinner and 16 wooden pegs (4 each in 4 different colors)

35419.name: Monkey's Uncle
35419.description: Monkey's Uncle from Transogram uses a timer, a spinner and a series of mats that have different tasks that need to be accomplished before the timer runs out. Things like Make a Sound, Build a Tower, Guess Who, Guess What are on cards that are drawn at random and must be accomplished in order to score points. You spin the spinner move to the color mat matching that spin and then try to accomplish the designated task before the timer runs out.

35420.name: Pre-Emptive Strike!
35420.description:
Pre-Emptive Strike! is a board game for 2 to 6 players in which each player controls one of the factions warring for control of the desert region of Iraghania. Pre-Emptive Strike! is a tongue-in-cheek look at our world’s current leaders and the problems they can all create.

The Pre-Emptive Strike! download, print, and play game contains over 700 full color tokens, a huge board game map, scenarios, faction tiles, and two full 56 card decks of event cards. All you need to bring to the table are the dice.

35421.name: Zecken Burger
35421.description:
From the publisher:

"Nasty ticks in big burgers

Tasty hamburger ingredients are placed on the table. Each player gets four ingredients on his hand and tries to build delicious burgers which get high scores. But hey, what's that? There's a tick between the ingredients. Try to get rid of it as fast as possible. Put it in a burger and hope that no one notices. Fortunately you also can put it in an opponent's burger. But he may give you his burger then and you mustn't refuse that nice 'gift'.
Bluff: Place your ingredients face-down on the table. So no one knows if it's cheese, salad, onions or a little tick. When your opponent gives you that burger, you'll get extra-score. Find the right strategy and the right face-expression to convince your opponents. When the cards are turned face-up, it's getting funny. Tick-Burger is a funny mixture of strategy, chance and bluff for the whole family."

35422.name: SuDoku: Die Spielesammlung
35422.description:
SuDoku: Die Spielesammlung is a set of six games which use similar Sudoku-like rules to govern placement of tiles.

In each game, players have identical sets of tiles (numbered 1-9 multiple times) and each turn play one which is randomly drawn. Certain defined sections of the board can only have one of each number in them. When each of certain small sections of the board is filled, the tiles for each player in the section are totaled and points given for first and second place. Bonus points are also given for players who complete larger board sections. The sections which define the placement constraints, regular scoring, and bonus scoring vary from game to game.

The six games are:

1. Classic-SuDoku, played on the standard 9x9 grid.

2. Labyrinth-SuDoku, played on a board divided into nine irregular nine-square sections.

3. Killer-SuDoku, played on a board divided into many small sections.

4. Kakuro, played on a 9x9 grid interrupted by numbered squares. This game can be played two ways - in one version the numbered squares provide an additional constraint and way to earn bonus points.

5. 3D-SuDoku, played on a board which depicts three faces of a cube, giving eight-space rows in three directions.

6. Hexa-SuDoku, played on a board divided into nine regions of nine hexagons each.

35423.description:
Politics year to year in the early American republic. Play begins with George Washington as president, with Vice President John Adams. Each player controls several statesmen as well as others who will appear, up through the arrival of Abraham Lincoln. Together the players try to solve the issues faced by the young republic -- wars, debt, financial panics, the growth of the Union, north-south division, and more. Every four years the most popular politicians from each party square off to see who becomes the next president.

Somewhat similar to The Republic of Rome, but with many modifications to suit the topic, including a completely different way of resolving elections and a more nuanced treatment of Issue cards (rather than simply Wars), plus novelties such as the Public Support Track, spendable Influence, political parties, more offices, tax cards, counterfactual events and an ever-expanding map of the United States.

If diplomacy is not your cup of tea, a variant printed in the rules removes all requirements to negotiate and makes it a matter of cardplay, drafting and utilization of resources.

Living rules available: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/founding-fathers:-green-edition
35423.name: Founding Fathers

35424.name: Hexpack
35424.description:
Hexpack is an extrapolation of the piecepack game system, and is basically an expansion to Piecepack, adding hexagonal tiles, as the name suggests. The hexpack is a public domain game system designed to encourage creative, open game development and design.

Additionally, by combining the concept of the hexpack with the concept of the SixPack set of the three red and three black piecepack suits, you end up with six suits, six sides per tile, six ranks of tile and coin, and of course, six sides on each die - as well as a six-sided SixPack suit selection die, if you like.

203044.name: Mutants and Death Ray Guns: Project Simian Ultra X

35425.description:
From the publisher:

Mutants and Death Ray Guns is a fast-paced, skirmish level, post-holocaust, science fantasy miniature system for two or more players. Based on the popular Song of Blades and Heroes mechanics, the rules are simple and, above all, FUN.

After 200 years of war with nuclear and biochemical weapons, new races compete for supremacy over a scorched Earth. Pit your band of after-the-bomb desperadoes, mutant humanoids, sentient plants, robots, androids, hyper-evolved animals and zombie-like Wretched against the dangers of a wasted world. Face irradiated terrain, contagious diseases, aggressive life forms and malfunctioning equipment. Collect artifacts, find food, fight over scarce pools of uncontaminated water, and save your resources, because in the harsh post-apocalypse world every energy cell, every ration and every drop of water means the difference between life and death.

Have you got what it takes to survive?

Designed for fast-play, you can finish a battle in 30-45 minutes; play a mini-campaign in one evening!

Play with any single-based miniature, in any scale.
Inexpensive and Convenient: play with as little as four miniatures per player. The game requires little space -- a 2'x2' table is enough!
Uses three sticks for easy measurement of movement and ranges!
Includes five factions: Humans, Androids, Mutants, Robots, Mutated Plants, Mutated Animals, and the disease-ridden Wretched!
40 pre-generated characters to start playing immediately and six scenarios included.
Complete rules for physical and mental mutations along with rules for power armor, high-tech weapons and psionic powers!
Campaign Rules: your characters become better fighters, gain new mutations and equipment after every battle.
Also includes a list of manufacturers of suitable miniatures.

Note: this is a complete, stand alone product. Purchase of Song of Blades and Heroes is not necessary.
35425.name: Mutants and Death Ray Guns

35426.name: Black Gold
35426.description:
From the game bix:


Purchase leases
Acquire a rig
Drill and complete
Sell oil to create revenue


The roll of the dice and the luck of the draw combined with the skillful movement of your token and keen Wildcat bidding could make you rich in the game of BLACK GOLD. But watch out for the Patch Problems.

For ages 8 to adult

ADDITIONAL note:
The game was created in the small town of Rhein, Saskatchewan Canada. No designer name given.

Box cover has 4 colour photographs of oil well-related scenes. Good board quality. Has look as though it would play along lines of Monopoly mechanics-wise

35427.name: Taktvoll Punktierte
35427.description:
An expansion for Takt Voll which adds dotted notes. Contains 112 cards.

Expands:

Takt Voll

35428.description:
Expansion for Bohnanza only available with the book "Das grosse Bohnanza Buch" and distributed at the Amigo booth at SPIEL 2015.
It adds 6 new cards to the game. Three of the Spiderbeans are orange, three are black. With this comes a new way of bluffing when you're trading the Spiderbeans.
When you harvest the SpiderBeans it's not just the number of beans that counts but more the way you planted them.

Expands:

Bohnanza
35428.name: Bohnanza: Spiderbeans

35429.name: Sauve qui poux!
35429.description:
Sauve qui poux is the third game from young French publisher L'Auberge des Jeux.
(The title is a word play in French that bases on "every man for himself ").

Description by publisher:
Caution: Completely delirious lice unload on an innocent head!

Use with relevance competences of your army - queen, workers, infantry, rifleman and chemists - to keep the supremacy of your colony.

Collect barrels of blood and play your action cards wisely.

Will you be able to lay enough nits and to protect them? Will you manage to occupy the gameboard strategically?
Solo or in teams, take the command of your units and make your adversaries bite the dust.

35430.name: Vem vet vad?
35430.description: A card game where players shall say things which starts with a particular letter on a card, that the player before has played. The player has succeeded when the answer is correct or another player is laughing.

35431.name: Medieval Knights
35431.description:
A small gift game sold at English heritage sights which feature castles, abbeys or some medieval history,

Game box comes with 5 pewter Knights from different ages in history, games is very basic get from one side of a slim checkered board to the other, one player has 4 figures the other player just 1.

from the back of the box:
This period in history relates to what was is know as the high middle ages, the three centuries between 1100 and 1485. the church was at the center of medieval life and castles where strongholds as well as centers of law and government. In the C11th and the C12th large numbers of knights left England for the religious wars of the crusades to the holy land. by the 1300s more than 1500 castles had been built throughout the land knights had more peaceful interests. Heraldry was the order of the day and the rules of chivalry; Tournaments of Arms and jousting were popular pastimes.

35432.name: Mix-Match
35432.description: Mix-Match is a 2-4 player abstract strategy game where players try to clear their own pieces from the 6x6 grid that comprises the game board. Each player may transpose 2 pieces, then remove a group of orthogonally adjacent pieces of the same color.

35433.name: IAGO Chess
35433.description:
IAGO Chess is unique in its nature. The best way to view IAGO Chess is a system used to manage the wide range of interests on the part of people who like to play, and an approach to acclimate new players to the system.
Because of this, you won't find one set of codified rules, as you would with other chess games. The IAGO Chess system accomplishes its objectives by the use of multiple versions (classes) of the game that represent the fullness of the chess experience. These versions build upon one another,
to allow a person to get fully familiar with the game. There are six versions (classes) of the game. These versions are: A-Class, B-Class, C-Class, M-Class, V-Class, and X-Class.

This version of chess is more than just a chess variant, it is a system by which chess can integrate variants and evolve. It has multiple layers and is robust enough to change over time. Its mission is to be a forever evolving version of chess that will provide a migration path for changes.

It is also meant as a framework for playing all versions of chess relating to the International Abstract Games Organization.

For the actual rules, check out the Chess Variants website:
http://www.chessvariants.org/index/msdisplay.php?itemid=MSia...

35435.description:
From the back of the box:
Akhenaton, Pharoah of Upper & Lower Egypt, God among men, all powerful sovereign, he trembles before no-one. There is, however, one mistake that even an immortal king cannot afford to make: forgetting his wedding anniversary. Especially when his wife is the exquisite Nefertiti.
Alas, the powerful monarch has almost made such an unforgivable blunder, remembering the event a mere two days before it is to take place. Now, he must find a veritable shower of queenly gifts.
The task of finding beautiful & original gifts falls upon his councilors - YOU!
It's time to play! Send you servants to the four corners of Egypt, from Gizeh to Abou Simbel & gather up the most impressive objects the realm has to offer. If your gifts are noteworthy and please Nefertiti, there is no doubt that the Pharaoh will reward you most generously.
35435.name: Nefertiti

35437.name: Jack Be Nimble
35437.description: To be the first player to place all of his candle pieces on the candle holder and then place the flame on the top of the candle.

35438.description:
Moto Grand Prix is an exciting game for all ages with a fast, realistic, dice-based system for playing multi-lap races quickly. Moto Grand Prix's beautiful, accurate models can lean and wheelie, and the modular boards allow a wide range of realistic circuits.

Although it takes just minutes to learn, experienced players and racing fans can add optional rules to crank up the realism even more.

The box includes

1 24-page rulebook
6 1:55 scale model bikes, each with a rider and a special stand
12 six-sided dice (in red, yellow, and blue)
72 racetrack tiles
6 dashboards and 18 plastic spinners for the dashboards
6 lap-counting cards
84 corner difficulty counters and18 plastic stands for the difficulty counters




Experience the thrill of high-speed motorcycle racing with Moto Grand Prix!

Race track tiles are 10cm wide and come in different length and shapes - straights and curves.
35438.name: Moto Grand Prix

35439.name: On The Spot
35439.description: The book consists of over a thousand moral dilemmas in the form of questions. A turn consists of a player answering a question from the book by secretly voting either 'yes' or 'no'. The other players must try to correctly guess that players' answer. A short discussion is allowed between the other players. Once all other players have made guess, each scores one point if correctly determining the questioned players answer . The player taking the turn will only score one point if there is a majority or equal number of other players that correctly guessed his/her answer.

35440.description:
The Killing Machine: Special Forces Supplement contains additional advanced rules for the Killing Machine miniatures wargame.

This supplement introduces:
Support Fire: On- and off-table support, and Forward Observers
Specialist Troop Types: Special Forces Elite Troops; Snipers; Assault Engineers
Insertion Techniques
New Equipment: Sneaksuits; LAWs; Robot Sentry-Guns
35440.name: Killing Machine: Special Forces Supplement

35441.name: Don't Upset Me
35441.description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to move any one of his "men" from his home base all around the game field and back to his home base.
Game Components:
Base
Game field
Flippers
Label sheet
Steel ball
Bumpers
Men

35442.name: Ta & Ge
35442.description: For two players or more. The goal is to receive as many white pieces as possible. One player selects something on the wheel. The other player doesn't know what the other has selected and has to guess. Among the alternatives are "take two pieces", "give two pieces" and so on. Correct guesses are rewarded and wrong ones punished.

35443.name: Matrix
35443.description: In this solitaire cyberspace Piecepack game you move your icebreakers across the ice in search of the four Data Forts. Once located, you have to infiltrate the Forts with the corresponding color icebreaker. Just make sure you don't use all your strength before you have succeeded doing this, or you'll die from brain damage!!!

35444.name: 15 Minutes Of Fame
35444.description:
From the publisher:

"Are you ready for your 15 Minutes of Fame?
Test your wit and stretch your imagination as creatively-crafted clues are combined to reveal famous secret identities!

When you have the spotlight, how will you reveal your secret identity? You've picked....Arnold Schwarzenegger! Your first challenger might ask, "If you were a food, what type of food would you be?" Your answer could be, "mussels", or, "Weiner schnitzel", or even, "protein drink." The next question might be, "....what type of transportation would you be?" Your answer? How about, "a tank" or "Hummer." Your clues are limited only by your imagination!
Little by little, clue by clue, other players begin to develop a sense of your identity. 15 Minutes of Fame isn't always easy, but it's always fun, sometimes outrageous, frequently challenging and quite surprising!
It even includes a few customizable cards for personalized fun! Who knows where this will take you?"

35445.name: Witchlord
35445.description:
(From the Introduction to the Witchlord rulebook)

Witchlord is the natural adaptation of fantasy role gaming converted into a board game. There is a distinct advantage to fantasy role gaming from a board; and that is it gets rid of the need for a Game Master or scenario creator. The board, cards and matrix tables contain all the information necessary and the dice determine the outcome of your adventure. No human arbitrator is necessary.

All the passages, rooms, treasure and monsters are randomly generated. This makes no two adventures ever the same. Each time you enter the Witchlord's Castle you can expect a completely different scenario stocked with new treasure and monsters. As the player moves around the board, he will receive information about the configurations of the Witchlord's Castle. This will enable the player to plot his progress on the graph paper given.

The player will choose one of the six Adventure Classes to play. this determines the player's spell and weapon capability.

The player's objective in the game is to collect proficiency points. This is done by the slaying of monsters and the collection of treasure. Encounters and treasure are dictated by the playing cards and matrix tables. When the player reaches the 10th stratum or proficiency level, he must do battle with one of the Witchlord's generals. If the General is vanquished, the the player has won and earned safe passage out of Witchlord's Castle.

The Witchlord Game can be played as a single scenario, or as a campaign game.

35446.name: Stix
35446.description:
Stix is a set of:
50 wood rods
4 figures
1 target
1 Game rules with three Games

PICASSO
Think of a word or a term and then lay it with the wood rods

Al CAPONE
The board is made with the wood rods and you have to collect the most of them.

FLIPPER
A dexterity game where you have to hit the target.

35448.name: Tim LaHaye's Deluxe Bible Trivia Game
35448.description: Be the first player or team to collect 6 Bible coins by answering questions correctly. Includes 500 cards with 2000 questions.

35449.name: Ex und stop
35449.description:
Content:
board, 80 action and question cards, 90 garbage cards, 6 pawns, 1 detour marker, 1 disposing truck, 1 die

Ex and hopp! How easily the banana peel lands in the garbage pail and the old school book in the wastepaper basket.

But here in the game's "Clean-Town" the players are very busy to avoid garbage and to recycle it. Here the motto is "Ex and stop".
The players have the duty to bring the garbage cards to the right disposal locations. The winner is the player who disposed his garbage correctly and is back in his house first.

35450.name: Bitmoor
35450.description:
Content: board, 10 pawns, 2 dice

This is the exciting race of two "Bit-Schaften" of 5 bits each across the Bitmoor.
The aim of the game is to reach the opposite side with all 5 bits despite all obstacles and put them together in a row.

35451.name: Zipher
35451.description:
Numbered counters valued 1 - 4 are placed upside down on the gameboard. From the middle of the board a pawn is moved according to the number of squares mentioned on the start counter. An even number makes the pawn land on on counter, an uneven number lets the pawn get next to a counter. The start counter can be removed from the board and is the first gain of the first player. When the pawn lands on a counter, it is turned upside down, then the pawn is placed upon it, so the number becomes invisible. The player must name the right number in his next turn. When he is right the player may take the counter as a win, when wrong he loses a turn. When there are no more counters that can be gained in one turn, the game ends and the player having acquired the highest total when adding the number of the counters won, is the winner of Zipher.
NB the game is a 3 player game.

35452.description:
Lincoln’s War reflects the fickle nature of politics and its influence on military policy-making during the American Civil War. Here, the battlefield is an extension of the political arena. Many historical movers and shakers support or oppose their presidents’ war plans. Will Mr. Lincoln save the Union? Will Mr. Davis succeed in sundering one nation and creating another? How will you direct their political support?

Lincoln’s War is a card-driven game using cards to activate generals, but in Lincoln’s War, activation numbers are also political currency or PC. PC not only activates generals but promotes worthy commanders, purchases war material, forces indecisive commanders to act, and represents support for the war. A decisive PC point spread is an advantage in winning the game but driving an opponent to 0 PC (and 0 Congressional support) at the end of a turn will ensure victory, even in the face of defeat.

Unique features include a diceless combat system, seditious characters, and immobilization tokens. The combat system requires players to husband resources and congressional political support to ensure victory. Seditious characters oppose their respective Presidents’ handling of the war and sooner or later will erode a resident’s vital political support. Immobilization tokens reflect damage in the form of casualties, as well as hesitation, confusion and even insubordination.

Lincoln’s War contains:
1 22" x 34" map
1 color rulebook
1 color play and background booklet
162 Operations Cards
2 countersheets
2 player aid cards

Lincoln’s War was designed by John Poniske with the assistance of Mike Joslyn, and features the artwork of Niko Eskubi and map artwork by Mark Mahaffey.

(source: MMP website)
35452.name: Lincoln's War

35453.description:
(from Europa Simulazioni website:)

Strafexpedition 1916, using battalion level units, comes with a brand-new impulse system, which allows a remarkable level of interaction between the two players. Manoeuvring is by brigade, at times depending by the initiative of the single commanders.

To keep units and brigades in reserve, and the way you use them in battle, can make the difference between victory and defeat.

Great importance is given to the morale of troops, and to its wearing, which affects the units’ efficiency in combat, and can take them even to surrender.

The logistic effort is simply simulated using Logistics Points, that are the real "fuel" of any activity: attacks, artillery bombardment, trench building.

Bayonet assaults, machine guns fire, trenches and forts, terrible artillery bombardments, fast counterattacks, snow on high mountains, fighting over 2000 meters heights, crags bordering the valleys (and limiting the manoeuvre), Austro-Hungarian big guns (like Gudrun and Barbara, and Lang Georg, or 42 and 30,5 cm mortars), Kaiserjäger and Alpini, Landesschützen and Bersaglieri...

Components:

Two 22"x34" maps of the battlefield
840 die-cut counters
Standard rules and Scenario Instructions (four small and one large campaign scenario)
Charts, tables
Dice
Boxed
35453.name: Strafexpedition 1916

35455.name: Parallel Worlds
35455.description:
The game is a 2 to 4 player trick-taking card game using a deck of 25 custom cards.

From the publisher's website:
Parallel Worlds has a unique playing deck consisting of 25 cards, made up of four 6 card suits belonging to the elements Earth, Air, Fire and Water, plus a Wild card. Each of the suits is also represented by a "House" name that originates from the 1,000's of planets spread throughout space and time.

New Houses will be made available for collection and integration into any starter deck, enabling every player to customize their own deck to their personal taste. Before play commences each player can then select a complete 6 card suit from their own customized deck to represent them as "Temporal Adjuster" within the game.

35456.name: Big Buck Deer Hunt
35456.description:
A two to four player game where one player is the "buck."
Players role dice in order to move through the forest in search special places on the board where there will be an opportunity to shoot the buck.
Along the way the hunters will encounter obstacles such as, "Mauled by a bear go back to camp and start over," or "Sprayed by a skunk go back to camp to change clothes"
The hunters win when on of them successfully kills the buck.
The Buck wins by "Must go to feeding station dot (upper center) and through no trespassing zone (upper right), any order, and then return to deer refuge dot (lower left).

35457.description:
One of the Great Campaigns of the American Civil War series modules.

This one covers Ambrose Burnside's attempt to cross the Rappahannock River in late 1862, a campaign which ended with the Battle of Fredericksburg. Necessary command counters are from The Skirmisher #2 and the maps from Stonewall's Last Battle and Grant Takes Command.

This module is found in The Skirmisher #2.
35457.name: Burnside Takes Command

boardgamefamily.102: Great Campaigns of the American Civil War

boardgameimplementation.215565: Roads to Gettysburg II: Lee Strikes North

35458.description:
One of the Great Campaigns of the American Civil War series modules.

This one covers Jubal Early's 1864 invasion of Maryland. The game uses the maps from Here Come the Rebels and Stonewall Jackson's Way.

This module is found in The Skirmisher #2.
35458.name: Rebels in the White House

boardgamefamily.102: Great Campaigns of the American Civil War

35459.name: Pima Indian Stick Game
35459.description: This stick game is a traditional game of the Pima Indians of the southwestern part of the US. The 4 sticks each have a pattern indicating a movement option around the track, which is a square with 4 "spaces" on each side. The sticks are cast in the air, and the way they fall determines which movement options the player has for that turn. Basic general rules about movement add some strategy to the order in which these movement options are taken. The first player to go around the track 3 times is the winner.

35461.description:
DAY OF THE RANGERS is an Ambush Alley scenario pack and rule expansion focused on US military actions leading up to and including Operation Gothic Serpent – a tumultuous period that culminated in the violent and dramatic events depicted in Mark Bowden’s award winning book, BLACK HAWK DOWN.

DAY OF THE RANGERS contains ten scenarios, ranging from historical to cinematic in nature. It also includes ORBATS for US forces, stats for the MH60 Black Hawk and AH6 Little Bird, and new rules that cover such topics as:

Insurgent Forces on Drugs
Mixed mobs: Civilians & Combatant units
Hostile Civilians
Stealthy Units
Suppressed Weapons
Danger Close Fire
Combat Stress
Positive Leaders
Helicopter Ops – Including Fast Rope Insertions and Gun Runs

DAY OF THE RANGERS gives players everything they need to plunge themselves into the hair-raising firefights and desperate heroism that the name “Mogadishu” has come to represent.

Expands:

Ambush Alley
35461.name: Ambush Alley: Day of the Rangers

56201.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Bravo

boardgamehonor.21223: 2009 Charles S. Roberts Best Expansion or Supplement for an Existing Game Nominee

35462.description: Lock 'n Load: Noville – Bastogne's Outpost American Riflemen depicts the battle for Noville (12/19-20, 1944) on a verdant 22" x 34" map created from actual maps of the period. There are six scenarios (listed below) and 85 new counters drawn by David Julien, featuring tense battles between American tank-infantry teams against Panzer Grenadiers, Volksgrenediers, and Panzers of the Wehrmacht. Noville -Bastogne's Outpost is an expansion.
35462.name: Lock 'n Load: Noville – Bastogne's Outpost

35463.name: That 70's Show Spin the Bottle Game
35463.description: "That 70's Show" Spin the Bottle Game was a promotional game released to FOX television affiliates in 2002. It contains a board with cast member's faces on which to spin the bottle, along with a bottle of orange Crush bearing a special "That 70's Show" bottle label.

35464.name: Uncle Lester's Word Game
35464.description:
Word game based on dictionary definitions. Board is circular with each space designating one of 11 different question categories. Players roll 2 dice, one die determines number of spaces moved, the other the level of question difficulty and point value. First player to 20 points wins the game.

From the box: "Lester Drotts loved wooden toys, games, and Christmas. He began developing this word game in the 80's on his Apple IIC computer and was planning on having it produced for sale. We have put together his brainchild and hope you will learn to love Uncle Lester's Word Game."

35465.description: Published in Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games", Network is a connection game played on a standard checkerboard. Unlike most connection games, Network doesn't require you to place your pieces next to each other, but only along unobstructed horizontal, vertical or diagonal lines.
35465.name: Network

35466.name: With Sword and Shield
35466.description:
With Sword And Shield is a 110 card game that brings you back in time to a medieval joust.
Here you step into the role of a knight and by playing different kind of strikes and manoeuvres against your opponent you try to hit him. To spice things up, different events may occur such as a cheering crowd or that your patron saint reveals himself. Your personal abilities may evolve and if you are lucky you may receive the sword of Ascalon, a battle-axe or any other great artefact. Once you control the basics of a joust you will be able to play a mêlée. Gather up to six players, split into two teams and start pounding each other. Or why not start a tournament?

Home Page: http://www.withswordandshield.3cg.se

35467.name: Bush Whacked
35467.description: Players make their way around the board by facing three challenges: Bush Trivia (Test your knowledge of America's 43rd president), Bushisms (Is it a real quote or a fake quote), and Bushwhacks (These make you go backwards). The first player to make their way around the board (in whichever direction) and successfully answers a trivia or bushism challenge wins the game

35468.description:
This Game is about placing tiles in a way that your own colour becomes the majority in the multicolour circles. The player whose colour dominates the circle is the only one who gets points.
Besides there is the posibility for a team play (2 on 2).
35468.name: On Top

35472.description: In Triovision, players are trying to move the pieces on the game board to match the shapes shown on the task cards. They can move only one piece in order to claim a card, however. Can they find the right move before another player? Whoever claims the most cards wins!
35472.name: Triovision

35473.description:
Pomorze 1939 starts on September 1st 1939 and deals with part of the campaign called Battle of Tuchola Forest. The map represents northern part of Poland - Pomerania.

Since German advantage is huge, polish player is placed in a very defensive role. The game should be played twice - giving opportunity for players to try each side.


Wikipedia: Battle of Tuchola Forest
35473.name: Pomorze 1939

35474.name: Pop Corn
35474.description:
Pop Corn is a fast-playing dexterity game.

In a round, each players pop the popcorns. Popcorn token fall in the table center, and some will pop, other will not.

Then each player haves 15 seconds to collect the Popcorns on their cards to collect points as fast as they can, but they must be careful, as each useless popcorn gives penalties.

35475.name: Det Store Indianer-Spil
35475.description:
Det Store Indianer-Spil (The Great Indian Game) is about gaining control of the opposing player(s) village, by having more Indians in the village than the owning player.

The same goes for the different areas of land, where it is possible to take control of each segment by having more Indians in the segment, denying the opposing Indians access to the area.

The game features both roll and move rules as well as fixed movement rules. The game is also playable with and without cavalry, and with 2-4 players.

Note:
I've investigated this game rather heavily, and as far as I can tell it is from before 1962 (where it appears in a Toy-maker's Guild anniversary catalogue)
However, the publisher no longer exists, and the owner of the publishing toy company died in 1991, leaving little to no traces to follow.

boardgamehonor.21162: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best World War 2 Era Board Wargame Nominee

35476.description:
GMT is proud to present Vance von Borries’ sixth epic game in his award winning series of East Front games, Barbarossa: Crimea. This is a two-player operational level game depicting the battles in the Crimean peninsula of the Soviet Union during 1941 and 1942. Beginning in mid-October 1941 and ending in January 1942, it completes the year 1941 in this series of the German invasion of the Soviet Union. And it includes 1942 scenarios of the continued fighting in Crimea until the historical fall of the great Soviet naval fortress Sevastopol in July 1942.

COMPONENTS
One 22x34 inch map
840 counters
Rule booklet in color
Playbook in color
Various player aid cards for charts and tables in color
Set up cards for each scenario in color
4 Scenario cards 11x17
1 ten sided die

THE GAME

This comprehensive game system was designed at a scale for divisions but it accommodates the many independent brigades, regiments, and special battalions that were also available for this campaign. These include units for rocket artillery, heavy artillery, armored trains, assault guns, engineers, Stukas, Sturmoviks, anti-aircraft guns, waffen SS, NKVD, militia, base units, naval units, and more. You have reinforcement options to tailor your army to fight a full campaign with many historical variables.

As we have indicated with each game, all games in this series share the same game mechanics. Veteran East Front Series (EFS) players will find much here that is familiar. Such mechanics include ranged artillery, air units for close support or interdiction, Soviet HQs, retreat or stand orders, weather, reaction movement, railroad movement, strategic movement, overruns, combined arms, fortifications, special supply situations, and more. Veteran players should be able to pick up game play right away, and for them we have clarified many game procedures. For those who are new to the series, examples of play will be found in the rules book as well as a Learning scenario to fully illustrate game play and some of the decision making for each battle.
